title: Kenya: Tax System to Go Digital - Oparanya
text:
Kenya: NCPB Maize Depots Still Full of Stocks 
"Stations will be put up in markets centres, where KCB will collect revenue from, using our staff," Oparanya said. 
The centres will also be used to disburse and recover loans from the recently launched Mikopo Mashinani initiative from small-scale traders, he said. 
The governor said the activation of the county's Revenue Collection Agency this financial year will also enhance revenue collection and reduce stealing at source. 
He said Kakamega collected Sh516 million in the 2014-15 financial year from its projection of Sh800 million. 
This was an improvement from the Sh300 million the previous year. 
Oparanya said the county projects to collect Sh1 billion this financial year. 
"If we collect enough revenue, overreliance on national government for funding will reduce. We have the potential to collect up to Sh3 billion locally," he said. 
The governor said the Commission on Revenue Allocation has developed five model laws in conjunction with the Kenya Manufacturers' Association. 
He said the templates will be circulated to all 47 counties to be tailored to their needs. Kenya
